name: Rebecca
review: All the girls at Rosie Nightingale have given my dad the best care, they really don't get the recognition they deserve, they treat my dad with respect, take time to have a moment with him to talk to, they are so helpful and so so very nice …

name: Jamie Gilmour
review: Rosie Nightingale helped support my Mum to live independently.  For many years they visited three times a day to make food, tidy up and help her manage her medication (her blood tests stabilized as soon as they got involved).  They always …

name: David Evans
review: Rosie Nightingale looked after my mum for four years visiting her four times per day and the care provided was always excellent with no missed visits in all that time. The staff were caring, friendly and always took the trouble to engage …

name: Eva
review: Rosie Nightingales looked after my father for over 6 years. That in itself speaks volumes!  All Rosie Nightingale staff not only care and support, but are always reliable. I never had to worry that my father would be left unattended and …

name: Dawn Cornwell
review: We have been fortunate to have care from the superb Rosie Nightingale Team for mum who suffers from dementia.  Each visit mum  has been made to feel comfortable and cared for in the best possible way.  A huge thanks to the amazing team.

name: Ruth Walsh
review: The staff at Rosie Nightingale looked after both our parents for almost three years.  We found them to be extremely reliable, efficient and most of all caring, building up a nice rapport with both our parents and also our friends and family …

name: Tim Dobie
review: We used Rosie Nightingale to provide a home care service for my brother who was suffering with Motor Neurone Disease. He was only in his late 30's when diagnosed and probably was not representative of the age of your average Rosie …

name: Gaynor Gough
review: Well organised Excellent at communicating to me regarding my dad. So caring with my dad. They clearly enjoy their jobs and really do care. The carers are lovely, so helpful and caring and extremely hardworking. They have been amazing with my dad and he enjoyed them going round to help him. Thank you all so much.

name: Carol Beattie
review: My mother-in-law, Herta has had Rosie Nightingale carers for some time now, four times a day. The care they have shown her has been wonderful. They are such lovely girls nothing is to much trouble. I would highly recommend them if somebody is thinking of care in the home.

name: Steve Ellison
review: The good people at Rosie Nightingale cared first for my dad, and then over the last three years for my mum. Without their kindness, help and assistance my parents would not have been able to stay in their own home as they did. They were all …

name: And G
review: Rosie Nightingale carers have visited Mum daily for a while. They are always reliable and offer to do whatever is needed to help out. I've always found them very friendly and would recommend them to anyone needing a carer.

name: Ken Haslam
review: I write this on behalf of my mum and dad. Rosie Nightingales looked after my dad for 2.5 years and they did an absolutely brilliant job. Nothing was too much trouble for the team. The care and attention meant that dad could stay at home and …

name: Cath Burt
review: I can’t thank the wonderful staff at Rosie Nightingale enough, especially during these difficult times. Marie, Abbie, Sammy, Jennifer and Andrea to name just a few, are so respectful and caring of my mum and have never let her down. My mum …

name: hayley mankelow
review: A fantastic group of carers with understanding and empathy.  Mark and his team of wonderful carers,  Yvonne, Helen, Bev, Sahara to name a few were brilliant.  They made the most difficult time a lot easier. Allan and our family will always remember your kindness.

name: Alison Tickle
review: Lovely caring people.  What a difference they made for my mum

name: Jacqueline
review: My mum was a client of rosie nightingales for over 2 years receiving visits 4 times per day plus extra 1 hour on mon/wed/Friday  the same team of carers coming in. Unfortunately Irene passed away in hospital on the 17th October 2022 not one …
